com.software.reuze

Class ga_Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.ga_Rectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ga_QuadtreePoint, ga_QuadtreePointIndex, ga_RectangleRotated, ga_Vector2Quadtree

    public class ga_Rectangle
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Encapsulates a 2D rectangle defined by its upper-left corner point and its extent in x (width) and y (height).
    Author:
    badlogicgames@gmail.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ga_Rectangle()
      Constructs a new rectangle with all values set to zero
      ga_Rectangle(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Constructs a new rectangle with the given corner point in the upper left and dimensions.
      ga_Rectangle(ga_Rectangle rect)
      Constructs a rectangle based on the given rectangle
      ga_Rectangle(ga_Vector2 position, float width, float height) 
      ga_Rectangle(ga_Vector2 p1, ga_Vector2 p2)
      Constructs a new rectangle defined by either of the two diagonally-opposite points.

      • union

        public final ga_Rectangle union(ga_Rectangle r)
        Updates the bounds of this rectangle by forming an union with the given rect. If the rects are not overlapping, the resulting bounds will be inclusive of both.
        Parameters:
        r -
        Returns:
        itself

      • union

        public final ga_Rectangle union(ga_Vector2 v)

      • intersect

        public final ga_Rectangle intersect(ga_Rectangle r)
        Creates a new rectangle by forming the intersection of this rectangle and the given other rect. The resulting bounds will be the rectangle of the overlay area or null if the rects do not intersect.
        Parameters:
        r - intersection partner rect
        Returns:
        new Rectangle or null

      • intersect

        public final ga_Vector2 intersect(ga_Ray2D ray,
                   float minDist,
                   float maxDist)
        Checks if the rectangle perimeter intersects with the given ray and if so computes the first intersection point. The method takes a min/max distance interval along the ray in which the intersection must occur.
        Parameters:
        ray - intersection ray
        minDist - minimum distance
        maxDist - max distance
        Returns:
        intersection point or null if no intersection in the given interval

      • getEdge

        public ga_Line2D getEdge(int id)
        Returns one of the rectangles edges as ga_Line2D. The edge IDs are:
        • 0 - top
        • 1 - right
        • 2 - bottom
        • 3 - left
        Parameters:
        id - edge ID
        Returns:
        edge as Line2D

      • getEdges

        public List<ga_Line2D> getEdges()

      • getMappedPointInRect

        public ga_Vector2 getMappedPointInRect(ga_Vector2 p)
        Computes the normalized position of the given point within this rectangle, so that a point at the top-left corner becomes {0,0} and bottom-right {1,1}. The original point is not modified. Together with #getUnmappedPointInRect(Vec2D) this function can be used to map a point from one rectangle to another.
        Parameters:
        p - point to be mapped
        Returns:
        mapped Vec2D

      • getRandomPoint

        public ga_Vector2 getRandomPoint()
        Creates a random point within the rectangle.
        Returns:
        Vec2D

      • getUnmappedPointInRect

        public ga_Vector2 getUnmappedPointInRect(ga_Vector2 p)
        Inverse operation of #getMappedPointInRect(Vec2D). Given a normalized point it computes the position within this rectangle, so that a point at {0,0} becomes the top-left corner and {1,1} bottom-right. The original point is not modified. Together with #getUnmappedPointInRect(Vec2D) this function can be used to map a point from one rectangle to another.
        Parameters:
        p - point to be mapped
        Returns:
        mapped Vec2D
